Overview.Phrase: Adding a package to Visual Studio using VisualBasic.

Introduction.Summary: This sample demonstrates how to create a Visual Studio package (VSPackage) in Visual Basic and add an entry for a VSPackage in the Help About dialog.
Introduction.Goal: Advertising the VSPackage in Help About

GettingStarted.Paragraph: The sample provides four independent VSPackages to demonstrate the different features.

BasicPackage: This VSPackage is the simplest one. It doesn't have any features and is provided as a guideline of a minimal VSPackage. It can be used as a base to diff other VSPackage classes to see how specific features can be added to existing VSPackages.

BuildingTheSample.Step: Press F5 to build the sample and launch Visual Studio from the experimental instance.

SampleTask.Description: To show the Help About and pause so you can see the advertisement...
SampleTask.Step: Open a Visual Studio Command Prompt and type devenv /rootsuffix Exp .

UnitTests.Test: Make sure the instance implements IVsPackage.
Make sure SetSite completes successfully when passed null (shutdown).

Make sure SetSite completes successfully when passed an IOleServiceProvider (Microsoft.VisualStudio.OLE.Interop.IServiceProvider) that provides a few basic services (SProfferService, SUIHostLocale, SVsResourceManager).
Make sure the instance implements IVsInstalledProduct.

Make sure calls to each method of the IVsInstalledProduct interface succeed. For those without string parameters, make sure the strings are not null and not empty. Note that this requires that the ResourceManager in our service provider provide an implementation for LoadResourceString.

FunctionalTests.Test: Verify sample builds in all configurations.
Verify if the sample got registered.
